channel.title: Comments on: Consumer group wants to tax Netflix to pay for rural broadband

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2011/02/25/consumer-group-wants-to-tax-netflix-to-pay-for-rural-broadband/#comment-3664">Claude Betancourt</a>.
I don't really have a problem with subsidies and regulations as methods to get things done. But I do think they need to have clear lines and boundaries, not expanded "just because".
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Claude Betancourt.

I don’t really have a problem with subsidies and regulations as methods to get things done. But I do think they need to have clear lines and boundaries, not expanded “just because”.

item.title: By: Claude Betancourt
item.dc:creator: Claude Betancourt
item.description:
Unless they're subsidized, landline telephone service is on the decline so the FCC (thanks FDR) need to find something else to regulate. Why isn't there ever a proposal to eliminate these old bureaucracies?
By the way, I am saving close to $35 on federal taxes since I switched to FiOS voice in early 2010. Apparently that's an unregulated service. Shhh...
item.content:encoded:
Unless they’re subsidized, landline telephone service is on the decline so the FCC (thanks FDR) need to find something else to regulate. Why isn’t there ever a proposal to eliminate these old bureaucracies?

By the way, I am saving close to $35 on federal taxes since I switched to FiOS voice in early 2010. Apparently that’s an unregulated service. Shhh…
